intro: Atrichoseris, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. These plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of narrow, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. The flowers are typically yellow and arranged in a single, erect inflorescence, which attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies. Atrichoseris species are often found in sandy soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. They play an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing food for local wildlife.
